title: Executive Order 6772-Exemption of Appointment of Secretary to the Aviation Commission Created by the Act of June 12, 1934, Public No. 308-Seventy-Third Congress
content: By virtue of the authority vested in me by the provisions of the last sentence of the eighth paragraph of subdivision second of section 2 of the Civil Service Act of January 16, 1883 (ch. 27, 22 Stat. 403, 404), the position of secretary to the aviation commission created by the act of June 12, 1934, Public, No. 308-Seventy-third Congress, is placed in the unclassified service, and appointment thereto may be made at the discretion of the aviation commission.
citation: Franklin D. Roosevelt, Executive Order 6772-Exemption of Appointment of Secretary to the Aviation Commission Created by the Act of June 12, 1934, Public No. 308-Seventy-Third Congress Online by Gerhard Peters and John T. Woolley, The American Presidency Project https://www.presidency.ucsb.edu/node/373472
